name: exec_python
description: Execute Python code in a persistent namespace (notebook semantics). Variables persist across calls. Use for computation, data processing, or anything Python can do. IMPORTANT: Never make network calls (HTTP, WebSocket, DB, SSH, etc.) with bare connections. Always wrap them with runtime.resource(factory) which returns a reconnectable handle that survives cryo store/reload. Pattern: handle = runtime.resource(lambda: create_connection(...)).teardown(lambda c: c.close()).retry(max_attempts=5) then use handle.get() to get the live connection. Call handle.invalidate() before cryo store. See /repo/docs/kernel.md for full API reference.

name: run_shell
description: Run a shell command. Working directory and environment variables persist across calls.
